materials.raw_text:
Chromium (III) Sulfide (Cr3S6) - 150 g 
 Terbium (Tb) - 50 g 
 Sulfur (S) - 20 g

sourcing.instructions:
Chromium (III) Sulfide can be sourced from chemical suppliers or online platforms specializing in inorganic compounds. 
 Terbium can be obtained from rare earth metal suppliers or specialized online chemical vendors. 
 Sulfur can be found at garden supply stores or chemical suppliers.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure 150 g of Chromium (III) Sulfide and place it in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 
 2. Add 50 g of Terbium and 20 g of Sulfur to the bowl. 
 3. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous mixture is achieved. 
 4. Ensure all materials are finely powdered to enhance reaction uniformity.
